intro: Lotononis leobordea, commonly known as the Leobordea lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are grass-like and form a dense rosette, while its stems are erect and bear the showy blooms. It is a perennial plant that is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
